value.title: Create a Datetime column in Power Query/ M language - Download 44
value.excerpt: In today's video I will show you how to create a Datetime column in Power Query. For that we will use three M functions: List.DateTimes, Duration.TotalDays, DateTime.LocalNow().  Download number #44 in the download center: https://curbal.com/donwload-center  Create calendars playlist: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-tg0m-WT1xE&list=PLDz00l_jz6zwrYvfWcWITHMiZf3G-HDq7

value.title: Create an environment for Power BI to run your Python scripts
value.excerpt: In today's video I will show you how you create an environment to run python scripts for Power BI.   If you haven't work with Python before, I recommend you to check this two videos first: Install python and more: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M2kZe9Pi6xg Guide to python and R: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BI8FcI_sgR0

value.title: Create an excel based budget app with PowerApps and use it in Power BI
value.excerpt: In today's video I will walk though how to create your first powerapp using excel and onedrive as a source.  The app will be a budget file app that we will them import into Power BI for further analysis, both the data and the app√∂  The possibilities are endeless!! Enjoy!    Looking for a download file?

This DAX function was introduced in the November 2018 Power BI Desktop Update, so make sure you have that installed if you wan to test it out.  Other resources:  DAX

value.excerpt: Let's go through DIVIDE() function available in DAX! value.title: DAX Fridays! #42: SUBSTITUTE (multiple values)
value.excerpt: In today's video, we will learn how to use the DAX function SUBSTITUTE.  Substitute changes text for another text.
